thread.title: Keller Rohrback Investigates Data Breach at Scottrade
thread.title_full: Keller Rohrback Investigates Data Breach at Scottrade

author: admin
title: Keller Rohrback Investigates Data Breach at Scottrade
text:
Companies mentioned in this article: Keller Rohrback L.L.P. 
SEATTLE -- (BUSINESS WIRE) -- Attorney Advertising. Keller Rohrback L.L.P. is investigating recent reports that discount brokerage firm Scottrade experienced a data breach that could have potentially put nearly five million past and current customers at risk. This Smart News Release features multimedia. View the full release here: http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20151002005843/en/ Keller Rohrback L.L.P. is investigating recent reports that discount brokerage firm Scottrade experienced a data breach affecting over 5 million customers. (Photo: Business Wire) 
Scottrade issued a statement announcing that they learned of the breach when federal law enforcement officials informed it of an ongoing investigation into cybersecurity issues at financial services companies. The company further revealed that the unauthorized access appears to have occurred between late 2013 and early 2014. 
While contact information, including names and addresses, were the focus of the hack, social security numbers and other sensitive data – information used to perpetrate identity theft – were also at risk. 
“Consumers have a right to expect that the companies they do business with will keep their information safe from criminals who can use this data to commit identity theft and fraud,” said Cari Laufenberg , a member of Keller Rohrback’s nationally recognized complex litigation group. 
Nearly five million Scottrade current and former customers nationwide may have been exposed in the attack. If you are concerned that your personal information was breached and would like to know more about your rights, please contact attorneys Cari Laufenberg at (800) 776-6044 or via email at consumer@kellerrohrback.com . 
Keller Rohrback is a leader in representing consumer and employee victims of data breaches. Keller Rohrback has a long track-record of success with data breach litigation, including the Ninth Circuit case Krottner v. Starbucks where the court held that the theft of a laptop containing employees’ personally identifiable information sufficed to confer Article III standing on plaintiffs. 
The firm also serves as Co-Lead Counsel in the Sony Pictures Entertainment Inc. Data Breach case, where thousands of current and former employees’ claims are proceeding after prevailing against SPE’s motion to dismiss . In addition, Keller Rohrback represents plaintiffs in the Target consumer litigation pending in the District of Minnesota, as well as the Anthem Inc. Data Breach litigation. 
Keller Rohrback, with offices in New York, Seattle, Phoenix and Santa Barbara, serves as lead and co-lead counsel in class actions throughout the country. Our Complex Litigation Group is proud to offer its expertise to clients nationwide, and our trial lawyers have obtained judgments and settlements on behalf of clients in excess of seven billion dollars. 
Attorney Advertising. Prior results do not guarantee a similar outcome. View source version on businesswire.com: http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20151002005843/en/ Copyright © Business Wire 2015
